awd_abstract_narration: Three two-week workshops will be held to acquaint undergraduate                 professors with new curricula ideas and applications in the                     areas of mathematical modeling, geometry, and statistics.                       Leaders in each field, both academic and practitioners, will                    interact with seventy-five nationally drawn participants to                     enable them to understand new developments in these                             mathematical fields and to prepare applications-based modular                   materials suitable for classroom use.  Areas to be discussed                    are problem-solving strategies using combinatorics and graph                    theory, applications of analysis to biology, and graphical                      algorithms in the social sciences. In geometry, emphasis will                   center on tilings, combinatorial geometry, and studies in                       computational geometry.  Statistics will focus on data analysis                 and graphical techniques as applied to experimental design,                     quality control, and sociology.

inst.inst_name: Consortium For Mathematics & Its Applications Inc
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: CONSORTIUM FOR MATHEMATICS & ITS APPLICATIONS INC
